history.heading: Non-“space-qualified” linear (1-dimensional) “focal plane arrays” having all of the following:
history.title: Non-“space-qualified” linear (1-dimensional) “focal plane arrays” having all of the following:

supplement.heading: Supplement No. 1 to Part 774—The Commerce Control List

breadcrumbs: 6A002 Optical sensors and equipment, and “components” therefor, as follows (see List of Items Controlled).
history.text:
Non-“space-qualified” linear (1-dimensional) “focal plane arrays” having all of the following:
Individual elements with a peak response in the wavelength range exceeding 1,200 nm but not exceeding 3,000 nm; and
a.3.d.1. Individual elements with a peak response in the wavelength range exceeding 1,200 nm but not exceeding 3,000 nm; and
Any of the following:
a.3.d.2. Any of the following:
A ratio of 'scan direction' dimension of the detector element to the 'cross-scan direction' dimension of the detector element of less than 3.8; or
a.3.d.2.a. A ratio of 'scan direction' dimension of the detector element to the 'cross-scan direction' dimension of the detector element of less than 3.8; or
Signal processing in the detector elements;
a.3.d.2.b. Signal processing in the detector elements;
Note: 6A002.a.3.d does not control “focal plane arrays” (not to exceed 32 elements) having detector elements limited solely to germanium material.
Technical Note: For the purposes of 6A002.a.3.d, 'cross-scan direction' is defined as the axis parallel to the linear array of detector elements and the 'scan direction' is defined as the axis perpendicular to the linear array of detector elements.

content.html:
Technical Note:

For the purposes of 6A002.a.3.d, 'cross-scan direction' is defined as the axis parallel to the linear array of detector elements and the 'scan direction' is defined as the axis perpendicular to the linear array of detector elements.
content.text: Technical Note: For the purposes of 6A002.a.3.d, 'cross-scan direction' is defined as the axis parallel to the linear array of detector elements and the 'scan direction' is defined as the axis perpendicular to the linear array of detector elements.
